availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Marion Washington Herren (Metcalfe County, Kentucky, soldier.)

body.p: Metcalfe County, Kentucky, soldier. Kentucky native. Son of Washington Herren and Celia Miller Herren Trent. Stepson of William Trent. Resident of Barren County, Kentucky, in 1850. Resident of Metcalfe County in 1860. Served in the 6th Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry Regiment (U.S.A.) as a private from September 15, 1862, to July 14, 1865.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Barren County, Division 2, p. 480B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Metcalfe County, p. 856.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Metcalfe County, Lafayette Precinct, p. 72B.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers Who Served in Organizations From the State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 0066.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records (1852-1910), KDLA, Frankfort, KY, Roll 994027, Barren County Births.
Sandra K. Gorin, ed., Barren County, Kentucky, Will Book 3, October 1828 - May 1852: Including Rejected Wills and Unrecorded Wills from Earlier Will Books (Glasgow, KY: Sandra K. Gorin, 1991), 120.
